body: As its scientific name Callinectes sapidus (delicious beautiful swimmer) suggests, the blue crab is a tasty creature, often winding up in delicacies like Maryland crab cakes, crab-and-avocado salads and ''she-crab soup.'' Although blue crabs are most often associated with the Chesapeake Bay, they have lesser known digs in New York City. Commercial
title: Trapping Dinner in the Bay

body: A year ago, the Gerritsen Creek salt marshes on Jamaica Bay in Brooklyn were simply ''the creek,'' a fishing spot and informal local dump. They were a place to toss old tires and rusting car hulks, or for teenagers to hide out for clandestine beer parties. Old-timers could do a bit of illegal muskrat hunting or crab netting there. Now, like a worn
title: Come On In, the Swamp Is Fine; Wetland Beauty Restored, Just Off Flatbush Avenue

body: Lena Cymbrowitz, a first-term state assemblywoman from Brooklyn, died yesterday in Manhattan. She was 43. Her family said she had been ill for a long time, but gave no details. Ms. Cymbrowitz, a Democrat, represented the 45th District, which includes Sheepshead Bay, Manhattan Beach, Gerritsen Beach and parts of Flatbush, Midwood and Brighton Beach.
title: Lena Cymbrowitz -- Brooklyn Assemblywoman, 43

author: E-mail address: daschn@nytimes.com
body: Past-Prime Pretzels Q. Sometimes the soft pretzels I buy on the street are not so soft. How long are they allowed to sit around before they are considered stale? A.
